ygData.subject: Re: Unable to install Cantera on i386 (RHEL WS3U5) compute node
ygData.msgSnippet: You have some undefined references in your Cantera Python interface shared library file _cantera.so.  This only affects the Python interface - C++ might work

You have some undefined references in your Cantera Python interface shared =
library file 
_cantera.so.  This only affects the Python interface - C++ mi=
ght work fine.  To see if it 
does, make some test directory somewhere, cd =
into it, then type "ctnew".  If this doesn't 
work, you need to run the 'se=
tup_cantera' script in your home directory, by typing 'source 
~/setup_cant=
era'

After typing 'ctnew', type 'make' then './demo'. If this runs, then t=
he Cantera C++ code is 
installed fine and it is some Python issue.



. --=
